trailingComments.value: Pause writing to curGroup in favor of writing to a sub-group.
When the sub-group finishes we will pop the stack and resume writing to its parent.
Contents will be added to by `addToCurrentGroup`.
curGroup.loc.end will be written to when closing it.

leadingComments.value: Contents will be added to by `addToCurrentGroup`.
curGroup.loc.end will be written to when closing it.
Pause writing to curGroup in favor of writing to a sub-group.
When the sub-group finishes we will pop the stack and resume writing to its parent.
Pause writing to curGroup in favor of writing to a sub-group.
When the sub-group finishes we will pop the stack and resume writing to its parent.
Spaced should always have at least two elements.
This can happen if there was just a comment.

trailingComments.value: When starting a new line, a spaced group is created implicitly.
When starting a new line, a spaced group is created implicitly.

leadingComments.value: When starting a new line, a spaced group is created implicitly.

trailingComments.value: When encountering a space, it both closes and opens a spaced group.
When encountering a space, it both closes and opens a spaced group.

leadingComments.value: When encountering a space, it both closes and opens a spaced group.

comments.value: Pause writing to curGroup in favor of writing to a sub-group.
When the sub-group finishes we will pop the stack and resume writing to its parent.
Contents will be added to by `addToCurrentGroup`.
curGroup.loc.end will be written to when closing it.
Spaced should always have at least two elements.
This can happen if there was just a comment.
It's OK to be missing a closing parenthesis if there's a block. E.g.:
When starting a new line, a spaced group is created implicitly.
When encountering a space, it both closes and opens a spaced group.
